original_title: How To Land A Model Rocket Vertically
original_content:
Perhaps most readers will remember when they saw the first SpaceX demonstration of a rocket stage landing vertically on the pad under control. Its something of a shock to be reminded that their first suborbital demonstration hops were around a decade ago, and how quickly what was once so special has become commonplace. Were now in the era of the more complex model rockets having the same capability, with [BPS.space] managing it last year, and now [TTS Aerospace] sharing a video showing how they achieved the same feat.
The basics of the system revolve around a directed rocket nozzle, but to make it work is a lot more complex than simply hooking up a flight controller and calling it good. The steps in arriving at a landable rocket are examined, with plenty of failures shown along the way. Even the legs are more complex than they might appear, having to combine lightness, ease of unfurling under the power of elastic, and enough strength and give to survive a rough landing.
Those of us from countries where model rocketry is a highly licensed activity can only look on in envy at these projects, and we look forward to seeing where this avenue leads next. We covered the [BPS.space] rocket last year, should you be interested.
title: 宇宙ロケットが地上で垂直に着陸
body: TTS Aerospaceが垂直着陸ロケットのデモ映像を公開し、商業的に可能になったことが報じられた。軽量化と強制的に伸びてくれる足など着陸に関する課題も指摘され、その取り組みの過程が紹介されている。また、複雑なモデルロケットも同様に着陸できるようになると期待されている。
titles: 宇宙ロケットが地上で垂直に着陸
より複雑なモデルロケットに同じ機能が
離着陸可能なロケットの作製過程
ロケット着陸の失敗例を紹介
モデルロケット制作に興味がある人必見！
